remarks.format:
## Remarks This class represents a collection of pairs, where each pair consists of a string serving as a collection key and a string value. Because the first element is a key, it must be unique across the collection.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the KeyValueConfigurationCollection type.
[!code-cs[System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.configuration.k_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.configuration.k_0_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the Clear method is called, it removes all <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement> objects from the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement CreateNewElement() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, the CreateNewElement method creates a new object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Override the CreateNewElement method to create custom <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement> objects. When a collection is loaded from the configuration file, the CreateNewElement method is called to create individual elements. The CreateNewElement method must be overridden in classes that derive from the <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection> class.

Docs.param: The to which the key should be returned.
Docs.summary: Gets the element key for a specified configuration element when overridden in a derived class.
Docs.returns: An object that acts as the key for the specified .

Docs.param: The key of the contained in the collection.
Docs.summary: Gets the object based on the supplied parameter.
Docs.value: A configuration element, or if the key does not exist in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the Item property to get a <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement> object in the collection based on the `key` parameter.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of configuration properties.
